64 inline CCircle orthogonal( CCircle C[3] )
65 {
66 
67  //The circle C_i is : <p,p> - 2<p,c_i> = d_i
68  double d[3];
69  for( int i = 0; i < 3; i ++ )
70  {
71  d[i] = C[i].r()*C[i].r() - mag2( C[i].c());
72  }
73 
74  //the common chord lines are <p,dc_k> = h_k
75  CPoint2 dc[2];
76 
77  dc[0] = C[1].c() - C[0].c();
78  dc[1] = C[2].c() - C[1].c();
79 
80  double h[2];
81  h[0] = ( d[0] - d[1] )/2.0;
82  h[1] = ( d[1] - d[2] )/2.0;
83 
84  double m[2][2];
85 
86  for( int i = 0; i < 2; i ++ )
87  for( int j = 0; j < 2; j ++ )
88  {
89  m[i][j] = dc[i]*dc[j];
90  }
91 
92  double det = m[0][0] * m[1][1] - m[1][0] * m[0][1];
93  double inv[2][2];
94 
95  inv[0][0] = m[1][1]/det;
96  inv[1][1] = m[0][0]/det;
97  inv[0][1] = -m[0][1]/det;
98  inv[1][0] = -m[1][0]/det;
99 
100  double x[2];
101  x[0] = inv[0][0] * h[0] + inv[0][1] * h[1];
102  x[1] = inv[1][0] * h[0] + inv[1][1] * h[1];
103 
104  CPoint2 center = dc[0] * x[0] + dc[1] * x[1];
105  CPoint2 centerM = center - C[0].c(); // Adeed by Dillon 2017/08/22
106 
107  //double radius = sqrt( mag2(center-C[0].c()) - C[0].r()*C[0].r() );
108  // Added by Dillon 2017/08/22
109  double radius = sqrt( mag2(centerM) - C[0].r()*C[0].r() );
110 
111  //printf("%f %f %f\n", radius, sqrt( mag2(center-C[1].c()) - C[1].r()*C[1].r() ), sqrt( mag2(center-C[2].c()) - C[2].r()*C[2].r() ) );
112 
113  return CCircle( center, radius );
114 };
115

118 inline int _circle_circle_intersection(CCircle C0, CCircle C1, CPoint2 & p0, CPoint2 & p1 )
119 {
120 
121  double x0 = C0.c()[0];
122  double y0 = C0.c()[1];
123  double r0 = C0.r();
124 
125  double x1 = C1.c()[0];
126  double y1 = C1.c()[1];
127  double r1 = C1.r();
128 
129  double a, dx, dy, d, h, rx, ry;
130  double x2, y2;
131 
132  /* dx and dy are the vertical and horizontal distances between
133  * the circle centers.
134  */
135  dx = x1 - x0;
136  dy = y1 - y0;
137 
138  /* Determine the straight-line distance between the centers. */
139  d = sqrt((dy*dy) + (dx*dx));
140 
141  /* Check for solvability. */
142  if (d > (r0 + r1))
143  {
144  /* no solution. circles do not intersect. */
145  return 0;
146  }
147  if (d < abs(r0 - r1))
148  {
149  /* no solution. one circle is contained in the other */
150  return 0;
151  }
152 
153  /* 'point 2' is the point where the line through the circle
154  * intersection points crosses the line between the circle
155  * centers.
156  */
157 
158  /* Determine the distance from point 0 to point 2. */
159  a = ((r0*r0) - (r1*r1) + (d*d)) / (2.0 * d) ;
160 
161  /* Determine the coordinates of point 2. */
162  x2 = x0 + (dx * a/d);
163  y2 = y0 + (dy * a/d);
164 
165  /* Determine the distance from point 2 to either of the
166  * intersection points.
167  */
168  h = sqrt((r0*r0) - (a*a));
169 
170  /* Now determine the offsets of the intersection points from
171  * point 2.
172  */
173  rx = -dy * (h/d);
174  ry = dx * (h/d);
175 
176  /* Determine the absolute intersection points. */
177  p0 = CPoint2( x2 + rx, y2+ry);
178  p1 = CPoint2( x2 - rx, y2-ry);
179 
180  return 1;
181 };
182 
183 
184 }; //namespace
185 
186 #endif
